performances.description: Stunning Europe '72 version.
Weir literally cries...check it out
Beautiful version.  Donna sounds great on this.
Sweet...Killer...Plain and Simple Great
Can't believe this isn't here!! Possibly the most epic 1970s LLR!!!!

performances.venue: Carolina Coliseum - University of South Carolina Columbia, SC
performances.description: Bobby goes off!!
Silky harmonies from Bobby and Donna Jean
Heady heights hit here by all parties...Donna really stepped it up for Tuscaloosa
Perfect version.  Even Donna is beautiful in this.

performances.venue: Pauley Pavilion - University of California Los Angeles, CA
performances.description: Just spectacular! Right out of one of the best Hear Comes Sunshine ever. Great show.This is a MUST listen.
still my favorite

performances.venue: New Haven Coliseum New Haven, CT
performances.description: Beautiful version. Equally delicate and powerful. Wonderful performances from everyone.

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York, NY

performances.description: a good version with a fierce Garcia solo
This version is great too.  Jerry gives a little more at end.
Truckin' Up To Buffalo version.
A fantastic version from a fantastic show!

performances.venue: Evans Field House, Northern Illinois University Dekalb, Il
performances.description: Bobby is on, but Jerry is on-er
Not a huge fan of this song, but this one is a WOW!

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York, NY
performances.description: Gorgeous version with Jer on pedal steel!

performances.venue: Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum Stadium Oakland, CA
performances.description: Donna, Bob, & Jerry play well together...  I have a cd with 7 versions of this song on it; this one and 2-26-73 are the best on it...Dick's Picks 33.
Gorgeous, par for the course in '77

performances.venue: Boise Pavilion - Boise State University Boise, ID
performances.description: The high point of my fav 1st set ever. Some of the best GD I've EVER heard. Stunning matrix too. X-Factor greatness. Listen to the entire set!!

performances.venue: St. Paul Civic Center Arena St. Paul, MN
performances.description: A perfect rendition and maybe best of May 77.  Bob and Donna really harmonize well at end.  This St. Paul show deserves more hype.
Extremely sweet and beautiful
Goes on and on and on . . . very fluid, wonderful
DiP 5....one solid, jerry-smothered version. bobby solid on vocals
The versions of most songs in Egypt are a little different and chill in a good way.  Cool Jerry guitar work at end.
Most beautiful guitar work by Jerry with a *stunning* instrumental break between verses with incredible interplay
A very emotional performace of this tune from a great show, New Year's Eve 1976.
Bobby's crying never ends!

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Very dynamic great Bob & Jer interplay
Bobby made it rain andthen made it stop.
Donna puts in a really strong and beautifull performance on top of Jerry's climatic ending delivery
Listen to the notes pop off Wolf.
Delicate subtly from Garcia, emotive playing.

performances.venue: Deer Creek Music Theater Noblesville, IN
performances.description: This one is stretched out. Solid Jerry shredding throughout.
OMG!!!!  This may just be the the best. Only downside is a brutal cut at the climax of Jerry's solo during the bridge...but this is still a must hear!

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Bob absolutely goes off!

performances.venue: Community War Memorial Auditorium Rochester, NY
performances.description: Another pretty version with Bob/Donna from 1977.

performances.venue: Springfield Civic Center Arena Springfield, MA
performances.description: Like this more than alot of the 77 versions.  Seems like Bob is more into it vocally at end and Jer giving better fills.

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York, NY
performances.description: Beautiful with the pedal steel.

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: Great looks like rain, this whole run is real strong. ALmost every note of the whole run is worth checking out.
Great one from the newest Dave's picks.
sweet version off new Dave's [icks, had up but comments turned to shit storm. ps i am not dude420 elmitobristol despite what you think, stay angry

performances.venue: Oklahoma City Fairgrounds Arena Oklahoma City, OK
performances.description: A mellow version from an amazing show
Garcia's leads are like lightning...Bob pleads for no more rain while thunder and lightning flood the P.A. and the crowd goes wild
Drippy, gooey, soulful, whatever you want, this is can't-miss stuff

performances.venue: Patrick Gymnasium - University of Vermont Burlington, VT
performances.description: The vocals are very impassioned, Jerry wailing away on the final, Donna in sync. LOVE this version, check it out.
Donna and Bobby sound great together while Jers guitar provides the rain.
Passionate
Sweet version.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Good Bobby singing. First LLR for east coast fall tour 83. Raining at MSG
Moves along nicely. Jerry is flawless.
Jerry/Brent rock on climatic ending. Best "LLR" http://www.archive.org/details/gd1981-05-09.senn421.eaton.miller.32883.sbeok.flac16
well for starters, Donna is IN TUNE. Also, DONNA IS IN TUNE!
Deserves to be on list.
Wonderful Bobby and Donna Vocals with a nice guitar throughout by Jerry. Beautiful and heartfelt.
Aftrr Jer brings the house down with MINTR Bobby and Donna follow with their own Rain song and bring it big time, wonderful pairing of great tunes.
Part of a sweet triumvirate to end set one.
very well performed. Re-master on the RFK boxset is sublime. Someone is triggering dramatic thunderstorm sound effects around the 7:00 mark.
A minute into this one and I'm wondering how it's not on here. Great audio, Bobby belting his heart out, worth checking out
Simply Amazing! sung to perfection and emotional as heck

performances.venue: Cole Field House College Park, MD
performances.description: Ripping run of Bird Song->Looks Like Rain->Deal.

performances.venue: William and Mary College Hall Williamsburg, VA
performances.description: Leads to a pretty nice peak. Good Donna contributions (there, I said it)

performances.venue: Activity Center - University of Colorado Boulder, CO
performances.description: I love these 81-82 LLR's with the F-bombs and Bob going off.

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York City, NY
performances.description: Bobby sings his heart out with gorgeous pedal steel from Jerry

performances.venue: Kansas City Municipal Auditorium Arena Kansas City, MO
performances.description: this one really builds in intensity until it hts soaring heights. Truly a magnificent though very early 80's sounding version.
Jerry soars and falls gracefully and Donna shines...truly beautiful rendition. Bob really performs with grace and power as well.
Listen closely: I HATE THIS SONG. Always have. So when I say this is killer it means a lot; & fans of this song tell me it's legendary.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Bob has beautiful version following the greatest scarlet/fire ever.  crowd still cheering into LLrain.
A very gentle version, but has somne perfection to it.

performances.venue: Field House - Seneca College Toronto, ON
performances.description: Donna and Bob harmonize so well as Jer does his pretty fills!  Gorgeous!
Extremely tight and well played by all; Bob and Donna in synch (and tune); very dynamic playing and Jerry shines with the accent notes.

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York, NY
performances.description: I cant implore you enough listen to this whole show. This is pure magic absolutely blissful. Find the miller snbd and enjoy it s FANTASTIC!!!!!!!!!!!!

performances.venue: St. Paul Civic Center Arena St. Paul, MN
performances.description: Beautiful all round, Jerry's playing is so delicate and perfect
This whole album seems to go unnoticed but this version is so smooth
impassioned '73 jazz LLR
Jazzy version from a great show
Surprised this version isn’t listed
The tightest version I have ever heard.  Perfect interplay between Bob & Jerry.  Some LLR's either Bobby or Jerry dominates but not on this night.
Great ending.

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York, NY
performances.description: Beatiful Pedal Steel
Just a stunning ensemble effort...Jerry's complimentary playing duing the verses is breathtaking!

performances.venue: William and Mary College Hall Williamsburg, VA
performances.description: awesome
fantastic version with great Bobby/Donna. Everyone else is just trying to match their emotional performances.
Effects laden version that works amazingly check the board.
Great vocals by Bobby and Donna. Silky smooth.
very nice
‘76 Looks Like Rains are also really good
Gorgeous version
Beautiful version of a song that normally doesn't really captivate me, especially great because Keith is high in the mix like he deserves to be
Can't imagine it getting any better than Summer' 73

performances.venue: Sam Boyd Silver Bowl Las Vegas, NV
performances.description: A long time favorite of mine that picks up as Jerry is tuning his guitar after a mid song string break.
Excellent version
Great guitar attack on this one . . . very strong . . .

performances.venue: Cassell Coliseum - Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University Blacksburg, VA
performances.description: Jerry does a fantastic Peggy O, slowing everything down, then Bobby and Donna come up with a LLR for the ages; everyone on-point, fantastic!
the first rain i ever heard..totally arresting..even better than europe 72 bonus track W/Jerry steel!
This song usually doesn't do it for me, but this is quite pretty. The SBD cuts out mid-solo, but it's a minor problem.
nice rap from Bobby at end, which draws out Jerry and Brent.
Awesome version Jerry just bending notes the whole time and Bobby and Donna in beautiful unison. The crowd clapping along warmly and energetically

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Great rock star tone by Jer in final jam before vocal reprise.
A great Greek version.
Check it out
Flawless delivery by Mr. Weir. Crystal clear boards are out there. the echo sounds oh-so right.  How this isn't already up here is unbelievable.
This is what LLR is all about -- silky harmonies with Bob and Donna at one of their vocal peaks, and Keith filling it in -- understated and exquisite.
Bob Sounds so goood on this
This LL Rain at this show is a pearl among the sludge. This is it! The band is on fire, and the outro features Weir going NUTS!
Heavy soloing, and an all around great version
Love this version.  Great Bobby screaming at the end with great fills by Jerry and Bruce.  This is worth a listen.

performances.venue: Cameron Indoor Stadium, Duke U Durham, NC
performances.description: every day some sun must shine!

performances.venue: Rutgers Athletic Center New Brunswick, NJ
performances.description: Excellent version with F-bomb included.

performances.venue: Buckeye Lake Music Center Hebron, OH
performances.description: Awesome show full of rain songs for those of us standing out in the pouring rain wit the temp dropping like mad. Id have left for ANY other band
Love this version with Bob on acoustic and Jer and his twangy guitar.  Great screaming by Bob at the end!
Another Hot Bobby Donna LL Rain with an absolutely ripping Hot Garcia solo. Very tasty, a classic version
awesome bobby rap, solid version through out.
Love Bob's rap on this one and Jer has a killer midi solo.
Great version with bob screaming abd beautiful organ underneath.  Jer rips it too.
Twinkles with emotion. Contained. Sounds mellow and heartfelt and oh the melodicness.

performances.venue: Roscoe Maples Pavilion - Stanford University Palo Alto, CA
performances.description: I call this the raindrop version due to the effect. Nice early LLR.
Bobby's ad libbing plus a slightly happy ending really suits the show's energy
Very powerful rendition. Weir is all emotion on this one. huge peak, see youtube for video
A beauty.
Sweet and soft and beautiful.
The fastest ever, by far!

performances.venue: Activity Center. Arizona State U Tempe, AZ

performances.description: So very tender. Check out Jerry's beautiful solo during the bridge!

performances.venue: Carrier Dome, Syracuse U Syracuse, NY
performances.description: another terrific version
jerry is terrific in this.
poignant singing from Bobby, and the whole band pours it on during the solo break. Note the drummers especially. Top notch version.
Excellent version, erry playing lines the whole song including some with a funky flavor to them and Bobby sings it beautifully, some really funky note
a grate hammed up version by bobby, there is a cool video on youtube.. saw it over there.

performances.venue: West Palm Beach Auditorium West Palm Beach, FL
performances.description: Cool version/cool Show
Jerry's guitar just sounds so freaking sick on this version. Awesome
Love all 82 LLR's.  Classic Bob with F-bomb.

performances.venue: Silva Hall at the Hult Center Eugene, OR
performances.description: Sweet + Soulful Coda. Jerry's crystalline leads, Brent's funky vamping and Phil's aerobic runs make this one a "Best Of" performance in my book
MONSTER two-keyboard version, with Bob just nailing it to the wall emotionally.

performances.venue: Curtis Hixon Convention Hall Tampa, FL
performances.description: Everyone contributes nicely
Garcia and Weir spinning higher and higher

performances.venue: Sam Boyd Silver Bowl Las Vegas, NV
performances.description: Beautiful version.

performances.venue: Assembly Hall, University of Illinois Champaign-Urbana, IL
performances.description: Great ‘73 looks like rain
Really listen to this one. Everyone really creates a beautiful, picturesque, powerful Looks Like Rain.
Impassioned Bobby delivery and great work from Jerry, Bruce and Mickey.

performances.venue: Deer Creek Music Center Noblesville, IN
performances.description: Strong version from a very good '94 show. We all know Jerry's playing was in decline at this point but the magic could still be mustered at times
Emphatic, even ferocious. Check it out.
Stunning version from a very underrated year. One of my favorites for sure

performances.venue: Greek Theatre - University of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Jerry splits the sky during the final jam that goes on and on. Greek Epic!
Fantastic!

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Has a strong ending.

performances.venue: Onondaga County War Memorial Syracuse, NY
performances.description: Who's playing the Theremin?  There's definitely something odd going on here.  Was Ned Lagin sitting in?
Flawless, emotive rendition, plus some mixing board wizardry; result is best heard on audience-recorded versions.
good sounds, bobbys beggin for it to stop raining. no other 84's figured id find a worthy one.
Just flipping beautiful.  Garcia rocks and Weir just nails it.

performances.venue: Campus Stadium - University Of California Santa Barbara, CA
performances.description: Part of me wishes they tried this hard all the time. Very nice version.
Great set placement, excellent Garcia and Bobby giving his all on vocals

performances.venue: Marin County Civic Center San Rafael, CA
performances.description: Bobby screaming and cursing, great 84'
another good one
electric raindrops for everyone

performances.venue: Long Beach Arena Long Beach, CA
performances.description: Beautiful, an exceptional first set, the ending trio of Candyman->LL Rain->Don't Ease is wonderful, Great show
There are some great versions after this one, but it never quite soars to the heights it does with Donna. Her backing is mesmerizing n Jerry nails it!
Heartfelt reading from Bobby with exquisite Guitar work from Jerry.
Real nice Bobby Donna duet, light and gorgeous.
Comeback show. Not sure why not listed
Best Ever Bobby Scat Vox Ending
I thought it was just an average one... then it built and built, stopped me in my tracks... Good stuff
One of the highlights of this great show.  Nice F-bomb.  Killer 7 minute jam follows with Bob hinting Playin.
Absolutely beautiful version.  Bobby at his finest.
Pissed off Bobby. Maybe you know how it's rainin'?
I like the way this one builds
How these guys (and gal) could turn such a cheese-ball song into massive lift-off spaceship jam event horizon is a modern miracle of music.
That thing where Bob and Donna Jean sound like they're deeply in love.

performances.venue: Radio City Music Hall New York, NY
performances.description: Bobby sounds great on this one and the Althea that follows is great
You’ll all wrong...this is the best
Well-played, Jerry offering up some tasty solos, Bob passionate in his delivery.
Love '73 Looks like Rains
Another emotional 1982 LLR from Bobby.
Sweet 73 version.
Spot on
Sweet Booby and Donna vocal lovemaking - I need a cigarette.
80s are a goldmine for LLR's, this one wirey, lustrous and cinematic.
Keith's gentle keys add SO much to this version - a very emotive rendition, just as it should be
Almost uptempo. Jerry rippin, Bobby singing well. Vamp is awesome. Good ass version.
garcia toys with grand funk during the 'i cant stand the rain' refrain,....I'm getting closer to my home
the return of the acoustic guitar
Everybody shines, even Donna...very nice
A very strong version.
Bobby REALLY doesn't want any more rain... This is a bute of a version though. Excellent Jerry leads

performances.venue: Allan Kirby Field House Lafayette College - Easton, PA
performances.description: Bobby wails beautifully on the "It's just that IIIII..." part..Nice guitar solo as well.
Another noteworthy '77 version. Listen for Jerry's melodic lines over Bob and Donna's vocal coda.

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: i am a sucker for a good looks like rain and this one is real good
One of the best from the early Brent years.
Absolutely gorgeous Bobby's delivery is impeccable and Jerry's guitar lines are sublime, a truly magnificent version. They were so ready to record
Bobby sounds possesed at times love the Healy effects and Echo, also Bobby does a cool call and response with himself and Jerry just blisters througho
Excellent version with gorgeous backing from Donna, F-A-N-T-A-S-T-I-C. Nice Phil bomb's & Jerry leads.
very solid version. spring '87 rocks!
Donna and Bobby in perfect sync, beautifully harmonizing, and backed up with brilliant Jerry fretwork. '76 was Donna's best year by far.
No doubt there's a little schmaltz factor on the lyrics and all, but Bobby and Donna just wash over you on this one like a wave of lovely heartache.
Can't believe this one hasnt been posted! Awesome jam, powerful ending energy > deal. smokin
Jerry and Keith are just on fire behind the beautiful vocal duet.  This show is underappreciated.  Give it a spin....
Brilliant rise to a climactic finish.  Jerry soloing like a man possessed behind sweet Bobby/Donna '76 harmonies.  Nice one.
Wish the fuckin’ clouds would go away
Rain, rain go away.. go fuck with someone else today
Give this a listen, as it's a thundering version!

performances.venue: Radio City Music Hall New York, NY
performances.description: Jerry's solo are dripping with emotion. Bobby goes for it vocally.

performances.venue: Cameron Indoor Stadium, Duke U Durham, NC
performances.description: No doubt with a better source this would be high up on the list. Listen to Jerry's supersonic flyby as Bobby and Donna caress the out chorus.
Great Hornsby era version from the overlooked Boston Garden run.

performances.venue: Community War Memorial Auditorium Rochester, NY
performances.description: Solid emotionally charged version with a great balanced soundboard right as the Fall tour kicks into blistering hot gear.

performances.venue: Golden Hall, Community Concourse San Diego, CA
performances.description: A very tender version from this bizarre show
Bobby's voice sounds so delicate.

performances.venue: Iowa State Fairgrounds Des Moines, IA
performances.description: Excellent quiet spots

performances.venue: Grand Prix Racecourse Watkins Glen, NY
performances.description: So beautiful
Great Bobby and Jer interplay - these late ‘79 versions have always been my favorite
The love, the power, the emotion, the audience is loving it

performances.venue: Cumberland County Civic Center Portland, ME
performances.description: Tender, soothing, perfect. Brimming with firecracker... jerry rips a mean fret-flyer or two

performances.venue: Greek Theatre - University of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: yet another symphonic slammer. Deeply meant.
starts with a dude talking about rain ends with dudes screaming about rain
Beautiful
cresting, passionate, blissful.
Jerry’s guitar is sublime and gorgeous, backed by Bruce’s piano, Vince’s keyboards and Bobby’s vocals are exactly perfect!
Like this one a lot! Perfect pacing, big emotive Jerry solo - delivers on song’s intent
Very sweet!!!!
first version with bob on acoustic

performances.venue: Deer Creek Music Center Noblesville, IN
performances.description: bobby with the drama, all his life he's seen rain

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Great version featuring heads up Garcia playing, and some classic late 80's Bobby vocals (with just the right amount of DH weirdness)
Powerful emotional reading from Bobby excellent Guitar from Jerry and fine work by the rest, one of those get lost in versions
This rises above much of the rest of a mediocre show and truly is a standout

performances.venue: Saenger Performing Arts Center New Orleans, LA
performances.description: Wonderfully emotional, extremely high level of intensity and full of energy.
Nicey echoy LL Rain a real beautiful version, hot run through.
Bobby kills it.
Heartfealt version
"Rain, rain, go away. Go away, get the fuck away!
"Wish them fuckin' clouds would go away!"
Great LL Rain from my first show. Some "thunder" audio weirdness (Healy?) makes this one unique. Nice raindrop notes fom Jerry at the climax, too.
Another strong version from Brent's last year. Colorful with a swirling energy.

performances.venue: St. Paul Auditorium St. Paul, MN
performances.description: Keith steps in when Jerry's guitar channel literally dies. Very nice, Mr. Godchaux.

performances.venue: Uni Dome, U of Northern Iowa Cedar Falls, IA
performances.description: This needs to b higher. Jerry plays with such emotion behind Bob and Donna, this needs to be heard.
Sweet slow buildup to an explosion of emotion and Jer's flying guitar work. A strong version.

performances.venue: Soldiers' and Sailors' Memorial Hall Kansas City, KS
performances.description: Pure Bobby drama, excellently wringing it out.

performances.venue: Veterans' Memorial Coliseum New Haven, CT
performances.description: Builds and builds.
Scorching. Which is a great word for this show. Scorching.
Absolutely beautiful. Prime 73.
The distorted instruments work weirdly well here. Hauntingly beautiful version.
Better than average version. Bobby's vocals at the end pair perfectly with Jerry's playing. Check it out.
Silky smooth rain. Jerry’s guitar melts and drips like raindrops dripping from a cloud

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: Very well delivered - a few mumbled F bombs
One of the last with Donna and Keith.

performances.venue: Assembly Hall, University Of Illinois Champaign, IL
performances.description: Incredibly powerful. Oozes desire.
One of the most precise and intense LLR's I've ever heard. If you like this song you have to hear this version
Bobby and Donna shine, truly emotive rendition.
Come on.
Beauty comes through the shitty soundboard.
Great rendition
Pretty but Powerful. Donna sounds great this whole Summer but the boys bring the punch here, too, especially toward the end.
This one’s real sharp
Another Formula 1 snapshot brent LLR. Bulging builds with graceful battering ram and icy southwestern lead work, jazzy patient coda. 40 years TDIGH

performances.venue: Niagara Falls Convention Center Niagara Falls, NY
performances.description: another bathroom mirror cabinet aria, this time with crack vibrato synth work, healy leprechauning, disco phil, chamber devils NOT ur average LLR
Perfect. The interplay between Bob's voice, Jerry's guitar and Brent's keys are perfect. (Miller SBD is sweet)
Brent's moog gives this 1 a bit of dr seuss, devils take a while to check in, but from first solo on, cooks into a thrilling workout!!!

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: Jerry's Guitar Effects on this One Steal the Show! Highly recommended if you love an Early 80's guitar exploration!

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: here come the rain
In the ship slot. Tones are purring in delight, brent and devils laying it in with goopy dark acrylic authority. Sings w/resonance, deep spectral lite
This entire show, especially second set, feels like the true Brent tribute. First after his death, Bob's singing is beautiful, band playing impeccably

performances.venue: Poplar Creek Music Theater Hofman Estates, IL
performances.description: Love early 80s versions of LLR. This one does not disappoint!
If it looks like rain and feels like rain, it's probably rain
I always thought Bob and Donna sound great on this version. Love LLR, even though some may think it to be cheesy. Keith also sounds great.

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Center Oakland, CA
Brendan Byrne Arena East Rutherford, NJ
performances.description: Flawless beautiful LLR with a spectacular finish
This one has something special for me.
Don't miss this treat by selecting only the famous May shows! Bobby/Donna are in rare perfection here. Perfect harmonies and sweet vox.

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Auditorium Oakland , Ca
performances.description: Awesome version
LLR around '89 can sometimes be a rushed, clunky mess. This is one of the exceptions- well-played, great solo. Out of a nice Foolish Heart.
Just at the beginning of my 76 listen-through here but the harmonies on this are beautiful, particularly in the outro.
